Python for climate scientists

I’ve helped organize a few different Python tutorials aimed at grad students and researchers interested in learning the language. Most of these center around NetCDF analysis and plotting maps. Currently, I’m helping to organize some Python sessions at UC Irvine; check out the GitHub repository here for more info.

I’m also getting a separate Python for climate scientists project going on GitHub. Please check in periodically for udpates.

This site's design was adapted from Jekyll Swiss and is maintained on GitHub here.
